summary: The Expanded Student Saver’s Tax Credit Act amends the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to allow full-time students to claim the saver’s credit and receive the saver’s match. It modifies sections 25B(c)(2) and 6433(c)(2) to include students eligible for a deduction under section 151. The amendments for the saver's credit apply to contributions made after the bill's enactment, and the changes to the saver’s match are effective as if included in the SECURE 2.0 Act of 2022.
